title: The sixth booke of the Myrrour of knighthood Being the first booke of the third part, immediatly follovving the fourth and fifth bookes printed. Conteining the knightly actions and amorous conuersations of Rosicleer and Rosabel his sonne, vvith diuers other their princely frends and kinsmen. Translated out of Spanish by R.P.
author: Martínez, Marcos, fl. 1598-1601. aut
publisher: Printed by Edvvard Allde for Curthbert [sic] Burby, and are to be sold at his shop nere the Royall Exchange,
notes: A translation of book 1 of part 3 of "Espejo de principes y cavalleros", written by Marcos Martínez. There are a total of four parts written by various authors.
The translation is sometimes attributed to Robert Parry or to Robert Parke.
Running title reads: The first booke of the third part of the Myrrour of knighthood.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
